critiques.subject: Living room seating area featuring a blue sofa, rust-colored accents, and built-in shelving
improvements: [MODERATE] Lift shadows in the background bookshelf area
[MODERATE] Reduce highlights in the window view
[SUBTLE] Desaturate yellows slightly in the neutrals
[SUBTLE] Increase local contrast (clarity) on textile textures
preserve: The rich color contrast between the rust orange and navy blue elements
The natural softness of the ambient light
critiques.notes: This is a well-composed interior shot that suffers primarily from dynamic range limitations common in mixed lighting. The main goal of editing should be to balance the bright window light with the dark recessed shelving while ensuring vertical lines are mathematically straight.

improvements_detailed.action: Lift shadows in the background bookshelf area
improvements_detailed.reason: The dark wood shelving creates a black void; lifting shadows will reveal architectural details and balance the exposure.

improvements_detailed.action: Reduce highlights in the window view
improvements_detailed.reason: Recovering highlight detail in the window will reduce the washout effect and make the exterior greenery more visible.

improvements_detailed.action: Correct vertical perspective distortion
improvements_detailed.reason: Ensure the vertical lines of the curtains and bookshelves are perfectly parallel to achieve a professional architectural look.

improvements_detailed.action: Desaturate yellows slightly in the neutrals
improvements_detailed.reason: The walls and ceiling have a slight yellow cast; cleaning this up will make the room look fresher without losing the warmth of the furniture.

improvements_detailed.action: Increase local contrast (clarity) on textile textures
improvements_detailed.reason: Enhance the tactile feel of the velvet sofa and patterned cushions.

context.subject: Living room seating area featuring a blue sofa, rust-colored accents, and built-in shelving
preserve: The rich color contrast between the rust orange and navy blue elements
The natural softness of the ambient light

critiques.subject: A styled living room interior with sofas, accent chairs, patterned curtains, and a large window as the backdrop
improvements: [MODERATE] Reduce window highlights (Highlights -40 to -70) and, if needed, use a linear gradient on the window to pull Exposure down ~-0.3 to -0.7 while lifting Shadows slightly (+10 to +25) to retain view detail without flattening the room
[MODERATE] Correct verticals and overall perspective (Transform/Guided Upright) to straighten window frame and walls; then fine-tune crop to maintain symmetry
[SUBTLE] Neutralize the warm cast slightly (Temp -200 to -500K, Tint as needed) and selectively cool whites on lampshades/walls using a luminance mask to avoid shifting the orange textiles too much
[SUBTLE] Add targeted midtone contrast/texture: apply a gentle S-curve or Contrast +10 to +20, plus Clarity/Texture +5 to +15 mainly on upholstery and curtains; keep walls smooth by masking

[SUBTLE] Subtle cleanup of distractions: remove/clone small bright reflections on the coffee table glass and any minor edge distractions; optionally reduce lamp hotspot brightness with a brush (Exposure -0.2 to -0.4)
preserve: The warm, cozy color palette of the textiles and decor
The overall symmetrical composition centered on the window and sofa
critiques.notes: The image is strong: sharp, well-styled, and naturally inviting with pleasing symmetry. The main opportunities are balancing the bright window area, tightening architectural lines, and making whites slightly cleaner while keeping the warm design intent intact.

improvements_detailed.action: Reduce window highlights (Highlights -40 to -70) and, if needed, use a linear gradient on the window to pull Exposure down ~-0.3 to -0.7 while lifting Shadows slightly (+10 to +25) to retain view detail without flattening the room
improvements_detailed.reason: The exterior view and window area are the brightest elements and compete for attention; recovering highlight detail improves balance and keeps focus on the room styling.

improvements_detailed.action: Correct verticals and overall perspective (Transform/Guided Upright) to straighten window frame and walls; then fine-tune crop to maintain symmetry
improvements_detailed.reason: Architectural/interior images benefit from clean geometry; subtle keystone distortion makes the space feel less polished.

improvements_detailed.action: Neutralize the warm cast slightly (Temp -200 to -500K, Tint as needed) and selectively cool whites on lampshades/walls using a luminance mask to avoid shifting the orange textiles too much
improvements_detailed.reason: A small WB correction keeps whites looking clean and premium while preserving the intentional warm, inviting palette.

improvements_detailed.action: Add targeted midtone contrast/texture: apply a gentle S-curve or Contrast +10 to +20, plus Clarity/Texture +5 to +15 mainly on upholstery and curtains; keep walls smooth by masking
improvements_detailed.reason: Enhances material definition and depth, making the interior feel more tactile without over-crunching the image.

improvements_detailed.action: Subtle cleanup of distractions: remove/clone small bright reflections on the coffee table glass and any minor edge distractions; optionally reduce lamp hotspot brightness with a brush (Exposure -0.2 to -0.4)
improvements_detailed.reason: Small specular highlights and bright spots pull the eye; cleanup creates a cleaner, more editorial interior look.

context.subject: A styled living room interior with sofas, accent chairs, patterned curtains, and a large window as the backdrop
preserve: The warm, cozy color palette of the textiles and decor
The overall symmetrical composition centered on the window and sofa
